results.title: The Mountain
results.creator_credit: Tapley Timms, H. Rodney Power, Leo Fowler, Robert Forster and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: George O’Brien and boy, Ian Timms, set out to climb Sugarloaf Peak near Buxton, north-east Victoria. Using his knowledge of bushcraft, the boy leads the climb with the man as a back-up to correct his mistakes. The man leads on the way down - the most difficult for finding the correct way to not get lost. George O’Brien is convenor of the Search & Rescue section of the Federation of Victorian Walking Clubs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tapley Timms, H. Rodney Power, Leo Fowler, Robert Forster and State Film Centre of Victoria

results.title: The Motorman
results.creator_credit: Gil LaRoche, Bernard Devlin and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A day in the life of a streetcar motorman shows him transporting hundreds of people to their places of business or to and from stores. We are shown the public as individuals, with little idiosyncracies and personal approaches to boarding a streetcar-amusing, or not, depending on the point of view-which are received with equanimity by the long-suffering driver. Photographed by Lorne C. Batchelor.

results.title: The Motion picture in persuasion
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Ott and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frank Capra: the man above the title”.
Based on Frank Capra’s book this documentary shows Capra’s involvement with the ‘Why We Fight’ series of World War Two. Capra reflects upon the use of film for overt ideological persuasion. Includes archival footage and excerpts from “Meet John Doe” and “It Happened One Night”.

results.title: The Motion picture and social change
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Ott and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frank Capra: the man above the title”.
A film about Capra’s preoccupation with films that depict social change. He talks about his ambitions and personal politics as reflected in many of his films.

results.title: The Mothers of Acari
results.brief_description: This film tells how Acari, a town in the interior of Brazil, came to possess a modern Maternity and Child Welfare Clinic. Initially, the clinic was established in a small house, but when UNICEF commenced the distribution of powdered milk, a bigger and better clinic became necessary. For the mothers of Acari, it was a new experience to receive constant care before, during and after the birth of their babies.

results.title: The Mother
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “The Australian eye III”.
Life and paintings of George W. Lambert, flamboyant Australian war artist, painter and poet, including the important painting “The Mother”. Talks of how he encouraged young painters including Roland Wakelin and Grace Cossington Smith and his involvement as a war artist and memorial sculptor. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Most beautiful place on earth: international zone
results.creator_credit: Martin Bunnel, Pierre des Bonnet and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: Shows the scientific research undertaken on Antarctica, which has been declared open for use by all mankind for scientific and peaceful purposes. This film shows the international co-operation achieved in efforts to preserve the unique environment of the continent.

results.title: The Mosquito
results.brief_description: The lifecycle of the mosquito, its breeding places, eggs, larvae, pupa, and the final stage. Methods used to combat the spread of mosquitoes are shown in detail.
